title: Barely works
text: That’s the best way I can put it. Barely works. The app is buggy and unreliable. Range is not the best either. Sometimes you have to just repeatedly do the same actions until it finally works. The app frequently loses devices or ‘cannot connect to server’ on multiple phones and different networks, so that clearly indicates centralized issues with wink. Their instructions are confused and unclear. E.g. they will send you instructions on how to connect a specific product, but the photo will be of a different one, so you have no clue what you are actually looking at. They also took nearly 2 months to even respond to a problem I had where my hub fell and broke, and i could not unpair the locks. They eventually solved the issue, after two months. That’s just dismal. At that time, they also started charging for the service... ridiculous. I am slowly phasing out wink at all of our properties and moving to the Samsung hub which has been a much better experience overall, and is free to use.

title: subscription is required even to see if it is working?
text: I bought a wink 2 hub as a means of connecting some smart light switches and a door lock I recently bought. When the hub arrived I installed the app and was shocked to find the app redirected me to a web page sort of implying i needed a subscription for all but the most basic features. ok, fine basic features for me i guess. the web page was a a bit unclear but it might have meant basic features were only available to previous grandfathered “customers” but didn’t really specify. i didn’t add a subscription and get an error even trying to recognize the hub (the app says it’s recognized but won’t connect). almost every screen in the app says subscription required. i don’t even know if it’s working right. i doubt i can return my hub. guess i’ll take this thing for the land fill. no way unlocking my door and turning i a light switch is worth $5 a month or my time to deal with this. guess i’ll just return the smart lock too and get something else. hope others see this and avoid buying their hardware. even if they want to offer a subscription it’s a major mistake to at least make the onboard experience painless and free and show me how great their platform is. in its current state i can’t even tell if it’s working or not.

title: Wink works but lack of update to app
text: Wink works flawlessly about 90 percent .  Its not focused on automation zealot but is great for the average joe/jane.  The features tend to be a bit minimal compared to some competitors.  Set up for nodes is extremely easy and straightforward and truly designed for the novice.  When I travel I do find the home sitter a major convenience   I pay the 5 / month fee reluctantly however do realize the piece of mind and convenience that the device brings.  I understand the change to kep the company alive even though the original attraction to wink was no fee and the lack of cloud retirement for wink2 What is unacceptable is the lack of icons and updates to the app.   The icon choices are minimal for a working home with multiple automation nodes.   When the monthly fee was discussed the programmers added some Icons and the hope for myself would be that the fee would facilitate more revisions (I did notice a revision that seemed to facilitate feature restrictions).  Yet i have not noticed any major enhancements.  In summary wink works well for me and my needs but the lack of app enhancements leads me to downgrade the rating.  With app improvements I would definitely upgrade the stars.

title: AVOID!
text:
I bought one of these Wink hubs to connect some smart devices around the home. I had to subscribe to their service just to get it connected which was not only a surprise, but probably the dumbest model I have ever seen from a smarthome company. But its only 4.99 so lets see if it works. Not a great start.
 
After several hours of trying to get it just to connect to my wifi (I work in technology and am very familiar with hardware, software and networking), I reached out to get some support. Fast forward a few days and no follow up from them. I reached out again. Fast forward another week and I get an email that they are inundated with support requests since they started requiring subscriptions and that my ticket is being closed and that I would need to reach out again to get support. Duh! You are getting complaints because your decision to require a subscription for basic services for a product we already paid for IS a HORRIBLE BUSINESS PRACTICE.
 
I cancelled my subscription, returned the product, am fighting for a refund for the $4.99 and now taking more time to share so that others will avoid wink and their products and services. They didn't deserve a cent from me, and they don't deserve a cent from anyone else.

title: Do not buy wink products!
text:
After investing in a Link starter kit and multiple additional bulbs, my system suddenly stopped working about a week ago. I tried everything, but after being unable to reconnect the Link hub to the network, I emailed support. I’ve been informed that since the Link Hub is no longer in production, this app no longer supports it. THEY ARE STILL SELLING THE LINK HUB ON THE WEBSITE. How can a company discontinue support for a product that they are still actively selling? And the solution was a tiny discount on an extremely more expensive starter kit. I’m done. Goodbye Wink.

Update: I read the developer feedback, and understand that unfortunately things do happen. However, when I contacted Wink regarding this issue (which I did before leaving feedback) I was offered an extremely small discount on their most expensive starter pack. Had I been offered any discount on a hub to correct this issue, I would have just ordered the hub and moved on. I did reply (twice) to Wink support to inquire about a discount on just the hub, and I have received absolutely no reply. Clearly they do not value their customers or they would have reached out before this incompatibility became an issue. As recent feedback indicates, I am not alone. C’mon Wink! Get it together!

title: All I Can Muster
text:
I had a wink hub after first discovering it and the potential it had. This graduated to the Wink Hub2 and I enjoyed seeing ways to automate my home. A huge selling point was the one time cost of the product without a maintenance subscription. I totally understand the need for the recent move to a monthly subscription, but ever since this change the reliability of the platform has evaporated. Automated items in my home now work less often than not. The hub is continuously offline or struggling to find devices. Whomever you hired to do whatever updates you’ve done recently should be kicked in the head and bounced. Whatever happened to the stability? Whatever happened to beta testing prior to roll out so you don’t alienate long time customers? Stop adding crap and fix what you have before it all goes up in smoke. Even though the cost to change out all my devices would be expensive, it’s become almost a necessity. Until Wink has ironed out the nonsensically undependable platform, you’d sadly be wasting your money and time. 
For the record I’m happy to reevaluate when/if they repair the stability but it’s currently 100% hooey.

title: Dump Wink NOW!
text: Dump Wink NOW before they collapse and trap your devices!    Wink is a sinking ship which is extorting its loyal customers to stay afloat for a few extra weeks. They have mismanaged their company, and as a result have launched a squeeze campaign which they call ‘subscription’ service.  On 27July2020 Wink made my Wink Hub2 unusable by turning off anything other than local WiFi control unless you pay them their blood money.  It would be like Ford demanding a monthly ransom to continue using their car, or Hamilton-Beech doing the same to continue using their blender.  Even my ability to remove devices was turned off...  which means that they weren’t just extorting the use of their device as a hub, but also holding any tethered devices hostage.  I actually had to pay $3.74 for a 1 month subscription just to release my devices from Wink.  I switched to Samsung SmartThings, and couldn’t be happier.  Smart things offers less expensive hubs, and has a much more intuitive display, and has shown significantly more reliable, timely and synchronized on/off switching for all my Zwave tethered devices....  all with no subscription.  Stay far far away from Wink!

title: Bait and switch
text:
I purchased a couple Aros/GE air conditioners because they seamed nice and could even be controlled by my phone like most modern window AC units, only to now see they have decided that the app to control the AC should cost $5 a month?! So you expect me to pay $60 a year just for the privilege of a remote? That is absurd. I’d end up paying more the the AC cost be over a few summers just for the subscription. It should be illegal to sell something then remove some of that functionality after it’s been purchased and force me to pay for it again. I would never have bought a window air conditioning unit that comes with a monthly fee! It’s literally cheaper for me to throw these out and buy a Midea, Frigidaire or other respectable brand. 

I could see a subscription maybe if you had all kinds of home automation stuff going on but I’m talking about basic on off and temp settings here. I should be allowed to control MY ac unit and maybe even set a schedule without having to pay monthly. My nest thermostat is far more sophisticated and they don’t charge a monthly fee. 

This price gouging bait and switch tactic is deplorable in my opinion.

title: EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SUPPORT!!
text: After spending two hours trying to re-pair my lock, I decided to call Wink customer support (it’s an anomaly they’re open until 9 EST—but I’m soooo thankful!). Ebony was very nice and advised me on how to fix the paring myself in an e-mail, along with instructions if the pairing failed. The pairing failed. I called back and spoke with Eli. Amongst his attentiveness and easy explanations of how to resolve my issue, we casually conversed about randomness while my hub went through the motions. I’m surprised his extensive walk through—along with my wait time—was only eight minutes! I like to think I’m pretty tech savvy... But, needless to say, I am not when it comes to connecting three devices that are so integrated on there own. MUCH THANKS to Eli and the Wink Customer Support for saving my sanity on this issue! I highly recommend the Wink hub since it’s been far more user friendly than any other hub, and the customer service is above par as well. Thanks again!!!

title: don’t bother with wink
text: Ive had problems since day one with wink. If my locks didn’t need it I’d be on some other platform. I’m looking into other hubs for possibilities too. The hub goes offline a lot. You call support and then tell you it’s too close.  No it’s too far. No it has a wall between it.  No there’s too much dust in the air. There always is an excuse. title: Bad business model
text: I’ve had the wink hub and associates wink products for several years.  The lightbulbs Disconnect from the service so frequently I stopped even bothering to reconnect them. But overall I was satisfied with continuing to use and support wink.  The reason I bought into their product in the first place was that there were 0 continuing costs, you simply bought the products and installed them.  Now that my house runs on automated everything, lighting, sensors, garage door, locks etc and have for years they want to start charging a fee.  I get that $5.00 is not much per month, but to spring it on customers with a week or less of notice is unacceptable. Not only that but unless you subscribe within the week all of the users home automation will literally stop working. The optics of this decision and roll out seem like nothing more than trying to strong arm customers into subscribing because they have no other options.  I’ve already purchased my replace hub and will sooner go a week or two with no automation than to give this company any money.

title: There is no free service.
text:
I can’t setup hub without paying a subscription, can’t even initialize it for the very first test. The list of “select products” for free service requires a paid subscription. And then after this deceit, the subscription is $4.99/months, which will cost more then the thing I bought it for in a year. They should at least have a tiered plan, but this is completely absurd.

So far I’m only out about $150 so not sure the pricy subscription with rudimentary automation options is going to work for me in the long run. 

I’m been using home automation tools for 6 years and I’m am consistently underwhelmed with products and this one is a better-than-average product in a sea of awful products and inconsistent UX experiences. Too bad there’s no way the company will last given the recent switch to the highly unpopular subscription model with unapologetically no tiered pricing.

title: BEWARE-This Version Deactivates GE Quirky Starter Hub
text: I’ve had the GE Quirky start kit hub for 3 years+ without any issues and it has survived many losses of power over the years. This new app version disconnected the hub upon launching the app. Then when I tried to reconnect I get a screen saying the starter hub is no longer in production and therefore cannot connect to this app version. What??? Something working fine gets booted off the app without any warning or alternative way to link to the lights it is suppose to support?  Now my “smart bulbs” are just regular light bulbs. If this company thinks that this is a way to force customers to buy a new hub- WRONG- this customer will be switching over to a non-wink system ASAP .  This practice by companies should be illegal. It is one thing to no longer support a device but to deactivate it without any way to reconnect to an alternative or older version of the app is like product theft. I paid for the device and it works fine. The company should not be forcing customers to a newer more expensive hub by disconnecting the hub from the devices it supports. Unbelievable...

title: Worst App, terrible Preformance, if it works at all
text:
Save yourself the frustration, stay far away from this company and their horrific products. I should have sent it back when years ago my WiFi password needed to be changed because if it’s not the length they demand, it doesn’t work.

title: Avoid Wink
text:
I love my home being held hostage by a company who lost their soul and moral compass.

I bought into this equipment early; had a hub, multiple wink bulbs, their digital egg carton, and kept building my home around Wink’s hub and app. Throughout the process there were bumps. Lights didn’t always respond or stay connected, if you lost power in the middle of the night, everything would turn on and be disconnected (so you’d have to get out of bed and disconnect power to everything). Through it all, I stuck it out because I had bought-in and was willing to wait for improvements.

After a few years, it was pretty stable, but the stability then shifted to stagnation. Things would work (most of the time), but there were no improvements, no new hardware, minimal feature advancements, etc. And that is fine, I was getting my money’s worth from the app and hardware, until May 7, 2020.

Wink decided to go to a paid subscription model that essentially kills your smart devices if you don’t pay them $5/month. Also, wink only gave everyone 7 days to comply or be locked out. This brings me to my final thoughts of this review.

Why would anyone pay $5/month for a service that fails often, has poor customer support, and hasn’t made improvements on its app, services, or hardware in YEARS?! You should not. AVOID WINK! It’s become a shady business that in reality will likely go bankrupt before the year is over.

title: Dying company, abysmal support
text:
After buying the GE/Wink AC a few years ago, I was thrilled with the product.  I understand that it’s a GE product, but when they switched to a subscription model it was noted that it would not be able to have the robots or cloud based system work without subscribing.  That’s ok... I can use it in network, not use any cloud data, and use the app as a remote while on the same WiFi network, right?

Nope.  They bricked any ability to use the app to control the unit.  When I asked support why, I was given a runaround about cloud data, etc... but it’s all within network.  What a crap move.  Cheap toys from China will connect via WiFi, but not my expensive AC!

If that’s the level of support they give, I don’t expect them to last much longer.  I get that it’s older and not upgradable to use with Home Kit, Alexa, etc... but to extort people to be able to use their app in my own network for something as small and simple as a remote control is crap.

title: Hub no longer works with wink accessories
text: I've had a wink relay for over a year now and really enjoy the ease of use of the system. The touchscreen always works and displays helpful information like the time and the weather. Unfortunately nothing will connect with the hub anymore. I have several wink supported light bulbs that do not connect, even after multiple times of connecting and reconnecting them to the hub. In addition to the light bulbs not connecting I have an ihome wink supported outlet that has worked off and on for months until one day it just wouldn't work at all. I've tried reconnecting everything to the hub and completely resetting the hub but nothing is working. Wink also has no Apple homekit support which is a big downside since it doesn't integrate with Siri at all. The product has great potential but horrible reliability. I hope they can fix the reliability issues and integrate apple homekit which would both make wink a great platform to use, but right now, I can't recommend it.

title: I need to learn my lesson and not continue to accept updates
text: Seriously.  Latest update for iOS 13 compatibility should also be fully bug tested for prior iOS versions “supported” as well.  We go on vacation and For some reason one of our lights (GE Link) on the porch that has been unresponsive for months decides to turn itself on by itself.  Tried to trigger a manual ZigBee update on the Wink router via this app and the app simply crashes.  Also the older scheduling option under the lights menu doesn’t actually trigger at times set when using the app on the phone in a different time zone... even if one explicitly chooses relative to sunset/sunrise based on the desired location. Useless

title: Removed watch app
text:
So all in one day I found that after an update the Apple Watch app has been discarded and my old Wink mini hub no longer works. 
So I went ahead and bought new Wink hub, expensive, but it does work. Since there is no watch app I have to rely on the widgets on my iPhone. But wait, the widgets go blank, meaning there are no choices. The only way to get the widgets to reload is to turn off the iPhone and restart it. What a pain. Thankfully I never totally bought into home automation and only have three light bulbs connected. I cant imagine what kind of nightmare it would be with more automation. Nothing like a real switch to turn something on and off reliably.

So I posted this review on July 3. Today July 18 I get a notification that the developer has responded. When I look at their response it says July 6. 
Anyway there has been no updates since their last update that took away the watch app and the widgets still don’t refresh unless you power off and on the phone. So even tho they say call or write them to help me I don’t see how you can help me unless you have a new app that addresses these issues. 
Have you heard of Yonomi. Well they have a Watch app that I am using to talk to Wink. It’s slow bc it has to go through two apps but at least I have a watch app and their widget actually refreshes without having to start it over. 
So Yonomi gets five stars Wink get one star.

title: No stars.
text:
If I could I would give this no stars.  Over and over the hub has issues.  Last week it stopped working with google home.  (Happened a few months ago as well). Well this time it’s been a week. I tried calling. Customer service office is closed even though it’s during normal hours.  They don’t respond to tickets submitted through the support form.   And the email listed to contact them bounces back as undeliverable.  

I got a basic generic response on twitter and Facebook saying we are working on a solution.  But they haven’t responded in four days.  And there is zero updates or even an acknowledgement of an issue.  And the status page they direct you to for updates is no longer a functioning page.  

The company is dying a slow painful death.  Do not waste your time or money on any wink products.  They will be defunct before you know it.  Look into other programs before you get a wink.

title: Wink No More
text: Had been using Wink for nearly 5 years. About a year ago I was about to upgrade to their Hub 2. Good thing I did a bit of research first. It was clear last year that Wink was on it's last legs. Several years ago it was a solid, basic smart home system; but the platform has completely stagnated for the past couple years. I decided to hold off and wait a bit before investing any more money in their system. The move to subscription service MIGHT have been acceptable if: a) they hadn't blackmailed their users with only a 7-day warning to pay up or lose complete control of their smart home devices, and b) they actually laid out their plan for improving the service other than to say "trust us, we've got big things planned" (paraphrased from their emails to users). Feels more like a last-ditch effort to get as much money from users before shuttering the business. Time to move to SmartThings.

title: WARNING!!!!!
text:
They will stop supporting a product and your hardware will NOT work again, basically your investment is crap to them. I have 2 hubs and 4 bulbs that are now worthless and I can’t use them simply because they decided to stop supporting it. title: No regard for old customers
text: After owning a Wink WiFi Air conditioner for over 3 years, they decide to disable the main feature and reason I purchased the A/C to begin with and try to force me to subscribe to their monthly subscription service in order to get that feature back. The Wink A/C doesn’t even come with a separate remote(common accessory with much cheaper A/Cs) because you are suppose to have functionality through your smart phone as it was originally advertised. There was never a subscription service before and now because of the service costs I’m getting rid of this Wink product because they don’t have the decency of grandfathering in their original users into their new subscription plan that was never needed in order to use their products as originally advertised over 3 years ago. I’m definitely not recommending this company anymore, so disappointed in this.

title: Subscription Cost TOO HIGH with NO new benefits
text: As usual, I asked Alexa to turn off my lamp.  It said see the WINK app.  WINK stopped providing the service unless you pay $4.99 a month for their algorithm to turn off your light!  Would have been better to charge less, like $1.99 a month.  I subscribed with the idea to buy time to look at their competitors who have better products and services (maybe Apple Home will have something interesting).  Since WINK didn’t give me any advance warning about this change (instead taking my smart home hostage and only saying in the FAQ they will come out with new features in the future . . . don’t hold your breath . . . they should have approached this change with new features already to share to show immediate added value in exchange for the subscription.  Instead it makes them look desperate and on the brink of financial collapse.). Look somewhere else!!!

title: Long time Wink user
text:
I have been with Wink since the early days. I still have yet to find another system with such an open platform that lets you connect to so many different brands of smart home tech. My home is connected in ways no other system works. I can schedule just about any combination of effects and lighting. More or less seamless use with Alexa. 
But the last few years have been rocky to say the least. Their products had become unavailable as did most of their tech support.  Very disappointing for a loyal fan. 
I am hoping that this new proposed subscription plan will get them back on their feet to once again create and support the best smart home system out there.

title: Needs bugs fixed
text:
Overall the app is mostly intuitive, BUT not completely intuitive as I have discovered.

1.  When adding a new device and you tap on the Name Device, you can name the device, but then it goes back to the same page and the Name Device doesn’t reflect the name you just gave.

2.  The Robots are not sorted alphabetically but are stored in the order as you add them....who’s bright idea was this?....OK then, I found that I can manually sort as I like, what a pain, and the way to do this is NOT intuitive.  The BAD is that when you are done the sort does not reflect the change, so I go back in to sort again but they are still sorted as I left them in the sort window, but the new sort does not get updated when you finish.

3.  It seems that if you modify your Robots, the changes don’t get updated.  I’ve had to reset the Hub for the changes to update.

The Wink software guys need better quality control or someone to actually use the app before releasing to the public.  I understand that some bugs are found by the public but some of the bugs should of been found by the software writers.  

The Wink hub is still a good device but only as good as the firmware and mobile apps.

3.

title: Nearly flawless home automation
text:

title: Wishing someone buys them out.

I always have to go out of the app and go back in to see lights I have turned off or on and so many other things just like this for sure.

title: Total rip off company
text: They started off by stating no subscription on there box. title: Useless without subscription

title: Will not sync with arlo anymore

title: Extortion is Wink’s business model
text:
I have been a Wink user for years and have 2 hubs and countless hours invested in home automation with Wink as the center of it all.  Now, virtually without warning, Wink has locked me out of my devices and notified me that if I would like my access back, I have to play them a ‘ransom’ of $4.99/mo to regain control of my home.  Essentially they are an unwelcome guest in my home, and wont leave unless I pay them a monthly ransom.
Wink... you should be ashamed of yourselves.   No company who expects to be in business a year from now would ever perpetrate such a scam on their customers.  There is sure to be a class action, an investigation by the FTC and AG’s office and customers bailing left and right.
The agreement that we had was ‘No Monthly Fee’.   Don’t try and hide behind some modified Terms of Service.  The court won’t allow it.

title: Best in class but room to improve
text:
What Wink does, it does well. For my set of devices (Hue, Lutron, MyQ, Sonos, Rachio, Ring, Various Sensors, Sirens, Wink Relay Control Panels, Nest—if you enabled before Google took away the ability), there is no better alternative.

With a small team, I understand why they do not support every device they could contractually support (e.g. the Lutron Caseta fan controller) immediately after it’s release.

I’m sure it’s just as frustrating for their team, as it is for us, when a manufacturer drops off or stops doing what they need to do to function on the platform. Most of the negative reviews on this app are from people on the receiving end of such changes, outside of their control.

I have reserved optimism that Wink will grow again, because they’re in a unique position to do so, they cannot rest on their laurels, because neither can their user base. I started this review by mentioning there is no better alternative—I just hope they realize that can change overnight.

title: Terrible System:  BEWARE
text: My last service call was really two service calls.  I had to wait 18:25 minutes prior to an answer on the first call.  The Wink person who answered thought that was normal.  The balance of the call was well over an hour before I was disconnected.  My second call was 56:54 minutes.  During the course of my almost three hour tech support session, I had to move all my components up and down three floors of my home, connect repeatedly to my WiFi network and via Ethernet (not easy, I don’t have many ports).  Ultimately, my problem was resolved after doing the same things over and over and over and over...  This is supposed to be a simple system.  It isn’t.  It ‘breaks’ frequently.  I’ve had to add extra hubs.  And still have problems all the time.  It isn’t worth the effort.  Install something else with greater reliability.

title: Bait and switch--buyer beware
text: Bought my Wink hub a few years ago and it's worked good for the most part. Some glitches here and there, but otherwise good. Just recently they stopped allowing me to use the services on the app that were the very basis upon which I bought it for, which were the Night function where you can set your lights to turn on at dusk and off at dawn, and the House Sitter function which randomize turning your lights on and off to make it look like you're home when you're away, unless I start paying them $5/month. This was NEVER disclosed when I purchased the product--rather it was advertised as a free app and service. This is a classic bait and switch. Instead of paying the fee I'm switching products, and I'm never buying anything from any company affiliated with it. STAY AWAY!

title: Do not buy
text: Just received an alert that wink will not work unless you purchase their subscription. Another monthly charge for no reason. They also stayed that your already purchased system will no longer work without the monthly fee. This product was already suffering and I was thinking of getting ride of it. Now I know for sure. Their updates are few and far if you have issues anyways. So long wink. BTW. I also present on tech to many interested in home automation. I’ll make sure their new fees end up making my slide shows. I’m not including anything that is not public already. Consumers have the right to all this information. Despite purchasing a product a few years ago because you did not have a monthly fee. And now they do this. So long Wink.

title: Times have changed and Wink is left behind
text: I used to really enjoy Wink and all the integrations over other platforms of its day but now the market is more crowded and some big players out there now.  Wink left me down a few times with lights magically getting disconnected and only resolutions was to reconnect.   Since HomeKit and the others assistance seemed to be the next big thing I decided to move forward with all HomeKit compatible devices and leave Wink for the few devices that only worked with Wink. It was a very wise decision. Wink went stagnant, no new innovations and then up and decided to charge you a month fee or shut down access.  I immediately removed all devices and practically gave my wink hub away since no one wants them anymore. Sad but no longer a recommended platform.

title: Old Timer Friendly
text:
My son usually does this kind of SMART installation but he was unavailable this time.  Initially I had difficulty in connecting to the hub2.  My guess is that I was trying to connect too soon after power it up.  It may have still been booting up?  That was late at night.  The next day I decided to give Wink Customer Service a call before I tried it again.  Got Hannah with Wink on the line and did not have any connectivity issues.  She helped me set it up and add devices.  She was very friendly and helpful.  This is how Customer Service should always be.  I recommend. 

 64 in CA.

title: Cash grab
text: Been with Wink since the beginning. They don’t care about customers because instead of slowing customers like me who have been there from day 1 to use what they paid for in full- they now want to be like every other company and make you shell out money each month for basic utility of their product. This is disgusting of how a company should run and don’t tell me you need to make money on customers every month in “fees” just to support the company. Does KOHLER tell people every time they go to the bathroom you need to pay them so the flush works ? No!!! You pay for a toilet once and it works. Why should that not be the same for Wink as well as all these other scammers just looking to pound the customer for more profit for something that their unit should do anyway ?!?

title: Unreliable platform and poor experience
text: Wink has been a pretty unreliable platform from the start. Disregarding the recent fiasco of giving a 1 week notice to customers their business model changed to subscription (hey, if you see the red flags why did you wait so long for this? Did you SUDDENLY realize the business model was unsustainable? Came out of the blue for you?), the wink cloud services have notorious lag and hubs would disconnect quite often. It is also crazy that the “local control” is super limited when the hub has trouble connecting to Wink services and essentially can render a lot of your smart devices, dumb. In the start - wink was one of few ok options. Nowadays there are plenty of options for your smart homes that are better than ok and better than Wink.

title: No new device support and no Apple Watch control - don’t buy
text:
I was a big fan of Wink until some time ago they dropped the Apple Watch support and they stopped adding new devices support such as the lutron fan control. Until Wink gets back in the game and understand if they don’t invest in their company by growing, advancing it and giving their paying subscribers (5 dollars a month) the service they deserve I would highly suggest you look for other home automation providers that provide horizontal and lateral growth which non of it Wink now provides. I may change my review if I see that wink has the right intentions but so far I have not seeing it and again I would discourage people from buying themselves into a dead company. 

Sorry wink. You were once a great company!

title: WINK IS A SCAM
text: I spent literally thousands of dollars on Wink over the last several years.  Moving from 4 Wink Hub 1’s to 2 Wink Hub 2’s.  I got my in-laws to install Wink security stuff.  I’ve been an extremely loyal and positive customer in spite of the lackluster support and frequent outages over the years.  The latest revelation that they are FORCING users to pay $5/month for a subscription in order to be able to use the service moving forward is ridiculous - and frankly I’m not even sure legal.  We were sold the idea that this was an investment up front with no monthly costs.  Now $60 per year?!?!  For a crappy platform that only works 80% of the time and hasn’t been updated in years?  No thanks.  What a disappointing waste, and way to go giving loyal customers the middle finger.

title: Buggy
text:
Have had this for several years now and the biggest issue is with changing the names of bulbs or plugs if you move a lamp or light to another room.  I have a new living room lamp and moved three bulbs to accommodate it from other rooms where I wasn’t using them/didn’t need/want them anymore.  I’ve changed the names of them several times and after a few days they always revert to what they were before, so when I tell Alexa to turn on living room 4 I get her saying a few things share that name and then I look in the wink app and the Alexa app and all of a sudden that bulb is kitchen 1 again.
Would love to see this fixed.

title: Glitchy and unreliable
text: The doors sensors are completely ineffective - it’s impossible to sync them properly. Wink always thinks the door is open even if it’s closed, and vice versa. And it’s almost impossible to remove a door sensor from the app and re-add it. I’ve tried to do so no less than 30 times and each time a get a notification saying the Wink Hub failed to enter pairing mode, even though the hub flashed blue lights multiple times which the app said indicates it’s in pairing mode. Their severs have been down globally on multiple occasions, rendering the entire hub and it’s connected devices completing useless. It’s not acceptable for a home security and automation company to be so unreliable. I tried to request a refund from Wink and they refused. This company really should not exist .

title: After buying product sudden subscription fee!
text: This product works well enough for us but a sudden change is why I’m marking it at 1 star. We bought it for a flat fee over a year or two ago and got an email this week saying they were going to start charging us (and everyone)a $5 a month prescription next week! What?! They are actually charging people for a service we never accepted when we bought the product months or years ago. I would never have selected this hub if I had to pay a subscription. They wait until the middle of a pandemic no less! So I’m in a challenging position with this right now. No one needs this headache. Clearly worst customer relations and roll out ever. Now I have to buy a new hub.

title: Do not UPDATE
text: I have been using this system for a few years with very minimal problems.  I use it at a gym business to turn on/off large HVAC, parking lighting and some ozone machines.  This system failed yesterday and we had to cancel some classes because for some reason my “robot” that had been working correctly for a year, for some reason did not turn off the ozone machine.  It was set to run for an hour but ran for 15+ hours, until I arrived and discovered it.  The next day, parking lot lights stayed on all night.  Not sure what’s happening but until there is another update I don’t believe I can trust this system.

title: Wink 2 Hub
text:
I recently moved so I had to build a new smart location to work with Wink. I also had my mobile phone stolen in the process. This led to confusion and I inadvertently created a second account causing me to lose connection with my Wink 2 hub. I emailed Wink support and got an immediate response and had my account restored in a very short time. KUDOS to David and Wink. 

I’ve used Wink for about three years now and find it the best app for bringing all of my various smart vendors to heel under one control platform. I hope Wink can continue to pioneer this open zigbee approach to smart home automation.

title: Sorry, but Wink Hub is not limited
text: I used insteon for years but now I'm really satisfied with Wink. That's so sad insteon is not integrated with Wink. The wink Alarm system need improvement but is still very good. Alarm is triggered when lack of energy. Motion detection when power down. Only door sensors stayed off and minutes later connected perfect. But door sensor says it is open and will not change the status till I open it. But this is not going to take any stars from this company. They are always working to solve or bring new things to us. Bring insteon to the list :)

title: Multifunction Multibrand Control
text: This product spans the breadth and depth of smart home devices and is the only one that does it in an uncomplicated manner.   I have not found a hub that spans so many smart devices and different brands.....to include Lutron Caseta.  The $4.95 subscription cost is well worth the minor investment for great service and continued moderization.  Pairs with Alexa and others to provide voice control of your smart devices.   I’ve had wink for 4 years and installed it in my moms house so she can turn lights on and off by voice.

title: Still not useful for Rheem water heater.
text:
Although a potentially useful app, the wink app still constantly disconnects from my Rheem water heater, sometimes even as I’m using it!!!!   Contacted Wink almost two months ago concerning this issue, they said they knew about it and working it.  Not sure how long it takes to fix something like this, but it seems like it should not take this long.  With all the problems I’ve read about in the reviews, I’m really surprised they haven’t put out an update in the last two months.

Wink is obviously not responsive to the needs or concerns of its users.  Recommend staying away from this company until they demonstrate they’re serious about providing a good product.

title: Wink is subscription model now with only one week notice for shut down
text: I highly suggest not using Wink. I’m glad we only got light switches on the Wink. I can’t image the nightmare of having my locks or home security system suddenly shut down. After a few years of finicky service last week it just shut down without any warning. It partiality came back online a day later (some times it worked and others it didn’t ) but the app notice said they were dropping service unless you subscribe. The Wink hub was promoted as no subscription when we bought it (and that was the whole reason we chose it). The hub is now a very expensive doorstop, since we have no intention of paying for iffy service.

title: Exceptional Support from Wink!
text:
I’ve been a loyal Wink customer for 5+ years and I have always been very happy with their products and technical support. Rarely do I have issues with the Wink system but today I called support for an issue I had been experiencing. Ali in support quickly identified and resolved the issue. Diagnosis: User error. I neglected to tap a switch when setting up new lights to an existing schedule. Thank you Ali!
I’m hoping Wink comes out with new product offerings soon as I would like to grow and expand my home’s install base.

title: So much potential but they never make improvements
text: We have had the Wink hub installed in our home for 3 years. We constantly have items unpairing and no luck repairing. Our garage was an option on the Wink to open and close and one day it disappeared from our menu. Also, I think it’s crazy when adding lights that you can not delete their default lights “Top Load Light”, I have light that show in my menu that do nothing. This company could do so much. Seems like they create fix it tickets and they do nothing. I can see them going out of business or being dissolved. They just don’t have what it takes for the long run.

title: Faulty Setup / No Customer Support
text: Contacted support services regarding wink hub 2 not connecting with the wink app/account. During initial setup, all is well up to adding the hub to my account. Have contacted support services with no reply refusing the problem. To charge a subscription and not return messages nor have a number to physically speak to someone is shady and bad business. To offer products on the market that are faulty, abs does not even allow initial setup, is horrible. Bad product, bad customer service, horrible methods to connect and address issues customers have with products! DO NOT BUY, WINK! There should be lawsuits against such an establishment. Must be held accountable for such grievous acts. If 0 stars was an option, that would be an honest review.

title: Suggested Improvements
text:
There are a number of things I would like to suggest for the Wink app.
1. Because the font is grey and tiny, it can be super hard to see especially in lower light scenarios.  Please enable the ability to increase the font and make it easier to see with higher contrast.
2. Allow for sorting of devices.  I know I can use groups but being able to sort the devices alphabetically or manually would be super helpful.
3. Continue to add icons for lights or allow us to upload a pic.  As an example, my garage has tube fluorescent lights and there isn’t a good icon. Neither for exterior house lights, fireplace etc.
4. Enable me to turn on a light and leave it on for x number of minutes/hours.
5. The app has become super slow.  Turning a light off or on is taking >30 seconds in some cases.  Turning services off is failing.  (I use ios).

Overall, I would like to see continued investment in this app even if I had to pay a little each year.

title: Perfect customer support
text:
I have had to contact Wink customer support many times and have always received a quick response and written directions how to fix my issues. My Schlage BE469 ZP had problem to synchronize with Wink. Eric said that this lock is defective and has to be changed by Schlage.
So I call to Schlage customer support, they tested this lock, and sent me new one. After changing the lock open/close function work perfect. Now I’m waiting for update application that will be fully support this lock.
Thank you Eric!!! Thanks Wink!!!

title: Not right product or technology
text: If you have purchased the hub, I will suggest you to return now and explore the other products in market instead of this hub. I purchased couple of years back and it never worked as expected. I tried contacting their support and they have very standard answers instead of helping to debug the issue. This is dead investment to purchase the hub and lights. On top of that, they have started the subscription for the same functionality, which was free earlier. After their subscription model, most of the time hub is down or it does not communicate with the app at all. So ended up operating the lights manually. I am throwing this product and exploring other options.

title: Good system but needs updating
text:
Overall the Wink system is good.  I've been using Wink for almost two years now.  The system has been responsive and reliable.  

However, it appears that Wink is not keeping their software up-to-date.  The Wink Apple Watch app was based on  WatchOS 1 and was never updated to newer OS versions (latest is WatchOS 4 as of writing).  This has caused the watch app to not benefit from advancements to the Apple Watch and has now resulted in the watch app being removed by Apple altogether.  

The home automation industry is fast moving.  If Wink can't keep up-to-date with the platforms it runs on, then it is going to fall to the competition and Wink will itself become obsolete.

title: Great Smart Home Platform
text:
I have had good luck with Wink.  I use Lutron switches, Chamberlain myQ, Schlage Locks,  Bali Shades, Nest, Ring, and Rachio Sprinkler Controller.  All works together perfectly for 3 years...  Had to call the help line to add a lock and Ben was helpful and knowledgeable (a human answered the phone). Like all newer tech, most glitches are user error.  Pay close attention to the instructions for adding the products because they are specific to each manufacturer.  Wink has done a great job to integrate these different products.
Just waiting for and iPad friendly app...

title: Needs improvement
text: I love the fact that I can use one app for multiple devices.  It’s super convenient to make sure my kids remembered to lock the door after they leave for school and when they get home.  The only issue I have is with the light bulbs it’s is nearly impossible to change the brightness because of the design on the app.  The fact that you have to move it in a circle which it never does (I have not gotten this to work once since I’ve had it) instead of maybe and up and down motion seem to be the main issue.  They really need to update this feature because I will not buy any more bulbs to use because of this issue.

title: Bait & switch
text:
1.) Wink has been progressively getting worse and dropping device support (i.e., Apple Watch, Chamberlain/myQ garage doors, etc.)

2.) Wink has added a subscription fee, forcing you to pay a fee or all of your devices – including Wink devices you already bought and used for years – will stop working.

3.) Supposedly, if you chose to *not* subscribe/pay, they were going to let you continue using your lights/switches locally (while at home, on your network), but this has turned out to *not* be true.

I have lost control of all of my Wink devices.

I have a ceiling fan that was on when the subscription model kicked in and I am unable to turn the fan off... at least, not without replacing the switch.

AVOID Wink!!  It’s a terrible and dishonest company that engages in extortion.

The device support was already getting worse and now they want to charge you for devices you already own.  

Everyone I know that used Wink has left and switched to other services, despite the money they already invested in Wink devices.  I am now doing the same.

title: The Best Home Automation Product!!
text:
I have been using the Wink hubs ever since they introduced them with a complete mix and match of products from different vendors. To date, I must say I have not a single issue. Their support has been top notch, even in those instances where I just emailed them. The fact that their hubs with those multiple radios make almost all products and the protocols cross compatible make it their wining feature.
On the mobile App front, I would like to see a refresher with some new icons and new themes.

title: Steer clear
text:
This service and product was very promising, but after several years, I’m sorry to say it has not kept up with its competitors. 

I was more patient when the service was free after purchase, but the implementation of a subscription, without noticeable improvement, leaves me with little choice but to recommend against others. 

Specific issues: loses connectivity to hub (wink 2) several times a week; commands ignored, such as turning on/off a light; inability to update or remove robots (routines); and indications in-app not matching their actual status, like a door showing locked when unlocked.

title: Beware before investing in Wink products!
text: I went all in on Wink a while back.  Bought the hub, sensors, leak detectors,etc.  Things were great for a while. But then, suddenly and without warning, I was logged out of the Wink app one day. No problem I thought, I’ll just log back in. The app wouldn’t take my password that I’m sure I used when I set up the account. Ok, time to reset the password. I click the reset button and a message tells me that an email has been sent. Three weeks later and multiple calls to support and I still can’t log in to the app and they tell me it is a known issue and they have no idea when it will be fixed?!!  Unbelievable!!  I am unable to use Wink at all!  Don’t buy!  I’m switching to Smart Things hub.

title: I wish I could give them negative stars!
text: DO NOT BUY WINK PRODUCTS! They care nothing about their customers! Their software updates are late as well as buggy and that’s just the beginning. They have announced (with almost NO warning) that they are going to start changing a monthly subscription fee. All of my existing products that have never required a subscription will cease to work if I refuse to start paying them monthly. APPLE should take this APP of the APP store. They want a ransom or your products that you already paid for will stop working. Fine Wink buy it all back at full retail!!!!! I’ve had Wink products for 5 or 6 years now and apparently that was 5 or 6 years too long.

title: Great customer support
text: I’ve had to contact Wink a couple times and have always gotten a quick response and good directions on how to fix my issue.  My power went out today and two of my three CREE light bulbs went off line, Benjamin gave me very thorough instructions on how to reset the bulbs - which are a little finicky themselves but thanks to his in-depth instructions I didn’t get frustrated! My Wink also syncs with my Google Home so I can lay in bed and tell Google to shut off my lights elsewhere in the house.

title: Wink hub constantly going offline
text: Wink hub constantly going offline. I set timers to turn on several lights through out the house when I’m away for work though the wink app with wink hub. I get calls from my neighbors saying my house is in total darkness at night for several days until I return. All other WiFi / Bluetooth products in my home work fine but the wink hub does not. Paid a lot of money for all the lights bulbs that are wink compatible and also for the wink hub. The product is not reliable and I have since told my friends and family not to consider any wink products. I’ve contacted customer service several times regarding the issue but seems to be no fix and the problem keeps reoccurring. Buyer beware.

title: Siri Shortcuts. WHERE ARE THEY?
text:
Now that Shortcuts has been out for quite some time and many apps that compete with Apple’s own in-house versions have successfully integrated with it (this one competes with Apple Home), it’s becoming more and more frustrating that I can’t say, “Hey Siri, shut off my living room light,” and have a Wink carry out this action. 

I honestly have no other issues with the Wink products I own, or the App, and would be compelled to give a 5-star review if not for what is becoming an increasingly glaring feature omission for those looking to leverage Siri for their home automation actions. Developers, are you listening?

title: Notifications don’t work
text: So the whole point of connecting “security devices and locks” that are smart is to get notified if an event occurs, right? Well after a month or so of having devices connected to my wink hub 2 (and a couple of app updates) I cannot get notification of device activity for any of the devices. I checked with support and nothing worked so they said work around it by setting up bots to perform that function and again no notifications pushed to Notification Center. I was also told it was an issue that was related to something on the iOS side, yet everything says it’s compatible. So I now have a useless hub that doesn’t do what I need most, NOTIFICATION of issues at my house. This is not good!

title: Helps us without monthly fees
text: I specifically bought the Wink to use for a rental cabin in Tennessee, eight hours away from us. We use it with the Schlage lock to modify door codes and monitor who enters the cabin. My only disappointment is that the battery warning does not notify us when the battery is going low. We’ve had a couple occasions where the batteries just died without warning. Usually change the batteries every 4 months to avoid this problem.  We have since added one for our home to control locks, lights, thermostats, and smoke detectors.

title: Going downhill fast
text: Are you guys still around? Are you bankrupt? I don’t understand how the quality of service has declined so much. I’ve submitted two tickets because I’m not getting low battery alerts for my lock. I was almost locked out of my house. Both times they’ve responded several days later asking to resubmit the ticket due to high volumes. What?  Le I’m sitting here trying to change the color on my light and set some robots it it takes minutes for the light to respond. Even after rebooting the hub. Are you guys even trying anymore? So disappointed.

title: Mediocre garbage at best
text: Even without the garbage subscription fee that they just popped up on us we had constant connection issues.  All of my devices would disconnect at random times and I would constantly have to factory reset the device and reconnect.  If we ever had a power fluctuation or had to turn off power at the breaker for some reason, I had to go through the same process and factory reset... the subscription fee has prompted me to get another hub device and have been happy with it so far.  Keep researching, I don’t recommend using this device or this app.  App functionality is clunky and is only somewhat user friendly.

title: Excellent Support
text: While it did take a while to connect with the technical support folks; only be open during the week isn’t the best for me, they are fantastic once you get through. They spend all the time you need to solve your problem, and make sure you are up and running before they let you go. I appreciate the extra time and attention to detail they provided. I am fairly tech savvy, but they reminded me of a couple of things, and gave me a few tricks that really makes my Wink work well.

title: Don’t buy this product and if you have it throw it out
text:
After years of owning wink power strips and WiFi controlled on/off switches, I threw out all my wink devices.  Wink decided they need to charge a subscription fee just to access features they’ve been giving customers for years....I hope they go out of business with this change.  

Paying $60 something dollars just to be able to control your WiFi devices through your app and making people pay for access to things they already had through the app? Seriously.  I hope the genius behind this idea figures out that he’s the reason for the failure of wink.

title: Subscription required after years
text: I have had a wink hub for years that has been used for basics. After several years of use I get an email that I can subscribe for $5 a month or lose my services. Imagine buying and owning a product for years only to be told that you can’t use it if you don’t pay for a subscription that was never needed. I get doing it for a new customer but not to customers that paid for your product and supported since day 1 when most products don’t even need a hub anymore as technology has evolved. I do not see Wink staying in business much longer and see this as a last attempt

title: Do not buy this hub!
text:
After using Wink for several years, and upgrading to their newest hub along the way, I have decide to switch smart hubs. The reason being is that after spending all this time with them, they decide to switch to a subscription service, and disable everyone who does not pay into their service. This does not sit well with me after dedicating so much effort to use their system. Since I have switch smart hubs, I have realized what I’ve been missing all these years with better integration and more stability (Wink would constantly go offline).

Long story short, save time and money and go with a different hub.

title: After Spending Hundreds on Wink Products They Want $4.99/month To Keep The Lights On
text: I bought a Wink Hub in 2017 and probably spent close to $300 on Wink products getting my home lit with their smart bulbs.  Just got a most unwelcome email from Wink notifying me that they are transitioning to a PAID subscription.  Unless I start paying them $4.99/month all of the Wink hardware I own will be deactivated on May 13 (that’s three days from now.)  For any prospective buyers, run for the hills.  This company is extorting their longtime customers.  A bait and switch if I’ve ever seen one.  For any other Wink users out there, I hope you’ll join me by throwing their equipment into the garbage where it belongs.

title: Accessibility!
text: This app has no accessibility for those who are blind or visually impaired. A corporation who makes apps and they don’t consider people with disabilities is a poor company and a poor app. I get this app zero stars if I could. I do not recommend this company for anyone specially if you’re blind or visually impaired. As they do not care with people with disabilities I give a 100% thumbs down also you have to pay for the service as well. Definitely not worth it to they don’t answer their phones at all! You should not have to pay a subscription fee when you buy a smart hub. That’s like paying for an Internet router that you purchased monthly.

title: Disappointed
text: The interface is slick but it won’t stay connected to my Rheem water heater account without having to reconnect the account after any changes are made on the water heater screen. This has been going on for YEARS but all I get from Wink support is “we’re working on it” and claim that the water heater still functions correctly. This is not always true since sometimes my water heater doesn’t turn on using the schedule in Wink. That’s fun having a cold shower out of the clear blue. Nearly every week I have the same issue with the Hue account and have to reconnect that to Wink. MyQ quit working months ago so really Wink is only controlling a few door locks and a Z-Wave switch. Not impressed.

title: Doesn’t work
text: The app hasn’t worked in several months, just crashes and won’t open. I’m not sure how long because it was always buggy and never showed the lights on/off correctly. I started using the individual apps for lights/garage/thermostats/ etc because they have always worked. More apps to keep up with but at least reliable. I also purchased this because of the one time payment. I DO NOT want to pay a monthly subscription. Especially for a device and app that even when it did work was not at all reliable. Disconnected now and going in the trash. I won’t even give this away.

title: Makeover?
text:
The Wink app is WAY overdue for a makeover or facelift!  I’ve been asking Wink and we just keep getting told eventually!

The app has not had any significant improvements to manage a large scale of devices!  It’d be nice to manage groups of devices by room and individually control them.

Overall the Wink hub handles my devices very well, there are just so many basic features that the app should offer.  It’d be nice when adjusting the brightness of a light that you could set the exact percentage without having to go look at it after you guess what it is.

Other apps, Philips Hue is constantly updating their app with very intuitive features.  Wink is well overdue and not very good developers at being creative.

Each update I get anxious that it finally has a new look and I can change settings such as app colors and add room photos or more icon selections?

Starting to have my doubts with confidence in Wink....

title: Worst business practices, by far
text: TL;DR - atrocious business practices, do not buy. Wink started out as a great product with a differentiated model, then investors pushed them to screw customers. Wink was sold as a home automation device with no subscription required. It had bugs but worked mostly. They ran out of money and changed to a monthly subscription model. Instead of adding the subscription for new users or adding new paywalled functionality they held existing users hostage and bricked their devices unless they started paying subscription fees. Also, the new T’s and C’s say they can interrupt services at any time, and they own your data. Do not trust these guys.

title: Doesn’t work well
text: System does not function properly.  Lights never turn on or off properly.  Of my 14 lights I control with wink, there are always a random few that are not connected.  Wait a day or 2 and it will randomly be a different few that are disconnected.  The ones that are connected don’t turn on or off as they should.  The “schedules” and “robots” don’t work like they should.  When I’m at home the location based control turn the lights on and off as as if coming and going from my house.  There are better systems that do not charge a monthly fee, do your homework before considering this system....

title: Paying for a decline in capability
text: For the most part I only had issues with Sylvania Smart Bulbs with a little work around and a couple other minor glitches, but overall was generally happy.  But now it’s a subscription service and as soon as I was paying to own a Wink, interaction with Alexa is very sporadic, lights frequently go on and off line, lost capability with our thermostat,  and Hub flashes / outages seem like daily occurrences.  Trying to stay patient with the changes,  but disappointed in the decline of a generally decent product.

title: Disappointed early adopter
text: I’ve been using wink and their products since 2015! After investing in both version of the hubs, 2 wink relays, and multiple accessories I am so disappointed. How dare you give one weeks notice for a forced subscription plan?!? I may have to pay for one months plan, but I’ve already began transitioning to other products. So long Wink. I’m sure you guys are about to shut down soon anyway, you haven’t released a new product since 2017. The subscription is probably a last effort cash grab before the company folds. I can’t even resell because no one is going to want your stuff anymore. Bye Felicia.

title: So far so good but update please
text: I have had Wink for a couple months now and haven’t had any issues with the way it works. I still am not able to confirm my email and this seems like an important security feature. Makes me wonder if that’s not working what else isn’t working. I wish there was more updates and fixes so I could feel like there is progress being made. Otherwise I love the app.

text:

Now in a sly email the company drops BOMB on all customers with only a ONE WEEK notice that everyone MUST either subscribe to our new terms at $5/ month OR everything that been working for years will be completely gone and you'll be locked out!! What are you thinking?!?!?

Screw this company, I'll be throwing my WINK controller in the trash ASAP! 

DO NOT BUY THIS CRAP!! 

I garrentee WINK will be hit with multiple lawsuits in the near future over this for EXTORTION due to the short time notice and no other option.  They'll go bankrupt either way.  Don't waste any more time or money to WINK they've just completely screwed themselves and ALL of their existing customers and people won't stock around for that!  

This is NOT what I signed up for and it is total BS...

title: Do not trust - now subscription required
text: Wink products and the company were founded on zero subscription fees. And had higher priced hardware because of that model. Now they’ve given us less than 1 week notice to enable a paid plan or they brick our devices. You would think a transition plan or an announcement with some general hints at a change in direction of the company, or at least a trial subscription for the members that bought under a different premise. But no, nothing but greed and poor decisions with incredibly poor timing with the current environment. I would find a different brand and service instead.

title: Kicked to the Curb with 1-Week Notice
text:
After using my Wink hub for 2 years, I just received an email from Wink advising me that if I want to continue using their app and hub I have to sign up for a subscription for $5.00/mo or have the app’s functionality disabled. 
Now, I’m the first to understand indefinite and worthy service and support can’t be free indefinitely, but its the way this was handled. No option was offered to continue using the current app for free for a period of time while offering premium services for a subscription. 
The loss of brand image and integrity will be forever remembered. A supportive customer has been forever lost.

title: Recent update
text:
Just updated my Wink Hub 2 and now the lights responds very slowly. They usually respond immediately but now it takes several seconds to turn on or off. Sometimes they don’t respond at all and I have to tap the icon a second time. Not liking that.

Update: it seems to have corrected itself. I rebooted my modem, router and the wink hub shortly after the update last night and it responded very slowly but by this morning, it was working normally again… Good news!

title: Works well
text: Works well but the hub itself is not meant to show up on Alexa app. The items added will show up but not the hub itself.  After hours of troubleshooting during the weekend customer support responded to my question first thing Monday morning. The items can be added one by one. Using cree bulbs and Bali blinds are next. So far so good.  Customer support was quick to respond.

title: Avoid At All Cost
text: I’ve had Wink since the beginning and invested hundreds in hubs and bulbs. Over the past year I’ve been using non-Wink bulbs connected to my Wink hub with no problems. Recently Wink has gone to a subscription service and all the bulb schedules that I’d programmed unless I sign up for the monthly subscription. Today I switched to Sengled, paired all by bulbs to the Sengled hub, setup my bulb schedules and deleted my Wink app. Everything works exactly the same, schedules, remote use and all for no monthly fee from Sengled. If you have Wink consider switching to Sengled. Only the Wink GE bulbs won’t connect to the Sengled hub. And the Sengled hub sells for under $30.

title: Bait and Switch
text: It’s bad enough that this product requires 5 bucks a month to work with Alexa or Google home...but the CLAIM implies that without spending the ongoing fees you can still set up and manage devices locally, and using the Wink app only. Buyer beware: nothing in the app allows you activate tour hub or add any devices to tour hub without (A) creating a subscription account and then (B) subscribing at the $5 a month fee rate. Fortunately I got my hub second hand (still new in box) so I am not out too much money. But now I know why the previous owner dumped it off unused into me. Where’s my electronic disposal station???

title: Going downhill fast - jump ship!
text: Been a fairly happy Wink user but the lack of updates and enhancements is making it more lucrative to jump ship to Samsung Smartthings. The wink robot (i.e. automation) used to have a “no motion” duration option so that I could have lights shut off if no one was in the room. They took that feature away and I’ve asked several times to get it back with the standard “well put it on the list” response. The last time this app was updated was ages ago and they took away features (apple watch). Strongly suggest looking for a different hub.

title: Very unhappy
text: Installation was a mess. It took hours to finally get everything to sync up. Now after about 6 months of use I realize that the Robots don’t work. At all. I was under the impression that a Robot would protect my home while I was sleeping by triggering an alarm when a door opened between certain hours. Now I realize this never worked properly. Connected a Cree bulb which operates fine with the app but set many Robots to turn it on and off at certain times and none of them work. What good is this product if all of it is manual. Automation doesn’t work. Do not buy. I’m going to find a better solution. What a waste.

title: Well, I must have gotten the Beta version of Quirky
text:
Given the opportunity, I would not have wasted my time or limited funds for this piece of useless plastic,metal,and glass "beautifully designed piece of garbage now taking up space in my bedroom window. 

To say it's a "little glitchy" is quite the understatement...Even new, having to remove my iPhone from it's Otter Box case to reset Quirky's connection to my internet became such a regular thing it completely stretched out the outer rubber casing and I had to replace the Otter Box (which was costly as well). 
So one year later I have both the need and help to install Quirky. And of course it needs to be reset, I call customer support only to discover that they are CLOSED ON SUNDAY until  11AM Monday EST. Business hours were 9-5 last time I looked. 
NEVER AGAIN! 

Save your time.  Save your money. Buy an old fashioned energy saving unit with a timer and a remote!

Quirky-Shame on you for releasing a Beta product on an unsuspecting public!

title: Service was bad... then they added a subscription fee
text:

Wink is terrible.

title: Long time customer...lowering stars..
text:
One of the best things about using Wink was using shortcuts from the Apple Watch. 

Wink never maintained it and, as a result, Apple pulled the app for not meeting app standards. Wink has no intention to update watch app, content with its removal.

----

As a long time customer, with a rather vast network, let me share that Wink does some great stuff for those just getting their feet wet with home automation.

Where it all fall apart is in how Wink actually works as a comprehensive solution for more robust networks. It will not be long before you have more items then their interface can handle well. The UI hasn't seen a significant (if any) update in many years.

So if you are just experimenting then Wink may be great. Keep expectations low, do not outgrow their services with too many products, and accept the sub-par UI is what-it-is, and you will be happy.
