text: Greedy company has bricked my entire smart home setup if I don’t pay them a monthly fee. Extorting their former customers in a bid to get more money is disgusting business practices. I’m unplugging today and deleting the app and will not be coming back. The only reason I own your crappy device is so I can control my lights through my Alexa device. You have over shot yourself thinking that your network is the center of anyone’s attention. You are an accessory trying to be a feature. Goodbye Wink.

title: Have had for 3+ years
text: Wink has been a good deal for me as I wanted to use a hub that integrated several different technical solutions and I needed something urgently 3 years ago. Updates are published as needed and are usually bug free. Also aligns with Alexa which came after had wink installed by self. Support is US based and they do a nice job; you may need to wait for call back at times but techs are good.

title: Charging a fee for a terrible product?
text: I’ve had Wink for two years and have dealt with their spotty product in hopes that it would improve. It seems to have only gotten worse over the last two years. Then two days ago I get an email from Wink saying that they are moving to a subscription model, and if I don’t pay $5 a month I will lose all of my integrations. Maybe try improving your product to something stable before forcing customers to pay for it. Good riddance Wink.

title: Wish I could give zero stars
text:
Switching to a subscription model was bad. What’s worse is that every time I open this garbage app to turn on wink hardware that I paid for and supposed that this garbage company would support indefinitely, I’m shown a splash screen to pay for a subscription that I’ve already opted not to pay for. 

Please take down the splash screen or give the option not to see it. It’s bad enough that I have to be reminded that I made a poor consumer choice years ago to buy wink products.

title: WINK - Customer Service
text: My Wink Hub-1 went out of service after a update, & I had to update to the Wink-2... WINK sent me the new Hub-2 & were phenomenal on helping me on getting the new system up and running.... The customer service representatives had to help me for hours.... Everyone that I had to work with, were very knowledge @ there jobs...Thanks again WINK.....

title: Subscription for mediocre service?
text: I’ve had my Wink hub for several years now and it’s always had its glitches.  Now Wink announces that they are going to start charging $5 a month or they will brick my hub and all of my devices.  I for one refuse to allow them to hold my devices for ransom and have ordered a new Hubitat Elevation, at $5 a month, I can pay for it in 2 years.  I feel sorry for any of the suckers who pay the subscription fee out of desperation, I can’t see Wink being around in another 6 months.

title: Completely unresponsive
text: Save yourself a lot of headache and find a different hub and service. Every other day the app interface becomes unresponsive and loses connection with our paired lights, power and services. Customer support is non-existent - I can’t believe after a couple years of using this product along with the investment I have to now find another hub and pair dozens of devices... Looking at these reviews, it’s like this company just closed up shop over the past few months. What happened?!

title: Worse ever and constantly offline
text: This has the be the worst setup and it constantly says offline. Instructions to troubleshoot issues are lacking, the app support is abysmal. I have had the wink hub 2 for about a year and it’s mostly says offline majority of the time. There is no instructions on the app on how to reconnect a light that is offline. The app is confusing and difficult to use. It is not intuitive and you have to navigate multiple layers of menus to get the a specific button.  The user interface needs a lot of improvement.

title: Now I need a subscription??
text:
After having My Wink Hub system for almost 3yrs, they now force you to buy a subscription to use your own programming that you spent time creating! SERIOUSLY?!!
Original owners should be grandfathered in, not forced to pay a monthly/yearly fee to use all the features. If they can’t sell enough products to support themselves, that’s a marketing issue. Everyone I come into contact with who wants to automate their homes, I will make sure to steer them to a different product line. Your welcome Wink!

title: Wink has worked very well
text: Wink has been a great system for us. Works well and very dependable. Have had a few bugs to work out over the years but all have been easily resolved. I’ve had no issues contacting customer support and they have worked with me for any issues I have had.

title: Subscription Fail
text:
Ive had wink for 3 years and LOVED it. They tried to charge a subscription a few months ago then got massive pushback so they rolled it back. Finally went through with the subscription now none of my automations work. i’ve added over 10 products to wink my entire smarthome is connected and now nothing works, awesome. I paid $110 for thier hub and now they want to charge
 me monthly. Good luck with thier new business model. Ill switch to google hub and get wont be charged a fee other than the initial hardware.

title: Sever connection issues
text: Frustrating server connection issues have me considering a change.  I understand why Wink suddenly started charging for the service and did not want to spend hundreds of dollars to replace my integrated devices.  I did expect more constant connection with this initiative and have not seen an improvement.  I hope they can get it right for their paying subscribers and loyal customers.

title: Don’t bother.
text: Wink is facing financial issues, and their solution has been to hold their customers’ installations for ransom. Between the customers leaving in droves and class action lawsuits... well, it’s not a good bet to put your money into a Wink system. Unless you just want the novelty of waiting for the day the company collapses and your smart home system stops working. If you need a reliable smart home hub, look elsewhere. There are many better options that haven’t pulled a fast one on their customers.

title: Wink using excessive battery on iPhone
text:
The wink app is using over 65% of my iPhone battery during the day which is killing my battery life. It just started recently. 

UPDATE:  Wink support worked with me to solve the issue.  I deleted the app and the battery usage problem disappeared. The next day I added the app back to the iPhone and the battery drainage issue did not reappear. Thanks.

title: Bulbs always offline.
text:
I have used Wink for many years now and it has been great. I started with the Wink Hub 1 and upgraded to Wink Hub 2 about a year ago. 

Unfortunately now I am becoming disappointed in the service i’m receiving. I having to reset the GE bulbs constantly because the app is always showing them offline. 

Hopefully the issues will get fixed soon. I really don’t want to start over with a new service.

title: Lights show up completely unreliable
text: I have one Lutron dimmer for regular bulbs and 8 Hue lights. All lights in one open space with direct line to Wink Hub 2. Actual control looks reasonably good I‘d say but what app shows is far from what it it. You turn off all lights, some of them are still shown as on while being off. You turn all lights on, all groups are still shown as off while all lights are actually on. And on, and on, and on...

title: Security and home automation!!!
text:
Awesome job Saved me hundreds by the many devices that control my home automation system/business too. Way to go guys!! Keep up the great work!!! 
  Had leaking pipes in basement and the water bug detected water quickly and was able to shut off the water!!! It worked really well!!

title: Great service
text: I have owned the Iris system and Smart Things and Wink Technical help is by far the best. So far the Wink hub 2 has worked great. The only suggestion I would have is to make the app easier to navigate and add more features. But as far as the system it has worked great and their support far exceeds others.

title: Deleting App - Good Bye Wink
text:
I wouldn’t waste your time with this anymore. Been finding it less and less useful as thing like Alexa and Google Home start doing the same things. That and Wink hasn’t had any meaningful integrations with 3rd parties in a while. 

Still feels the same after years of use and I have added A LOT more smart items...almost none of them are compatible with Wink. Come to think of it, the last thing I used it for was my garage door...and it has its own app anyways.

title: Bye
text:
So many random issues with devices, switches and light bulbs not working with constant restarting and troubleshooting... now you are asking for a monthly subscription? If the device worked like it was advertised - maybe. There are too many companies doing the exact same thing without a monthly fee.

It seems like a lot of companies are pulling their products from Wink. I’ll check back in a year when you produce something that is worth a monthly subscription fee.

title: Horrible product
text:
Do not buy this product, it is terrible and never worked well. The app most of the time doesn’t connect with my AC unit and I have to try to connect many times until it works. It’s horrible and customer services didn’t help at all.

And since a few days ago, the app is not even free anymore. So after spending more money in my “smart” AC unit that included this app for free and that never worked well, now I’m supposed to start paying for it. It’s a scam. DO NOT BUY IT

title: Buggy app, forced subscription
text: I purchased The wink 2 because it did not subscription model. The company has fallen on hard times and decided during a pandemic to start charging for your hardware to continue to run that I already paid for. They are literally trying to extort money out of people who have already paid for their hardware with out any options. They gave one week notice and will brick your devices if you don’t pay up. Sounds rather mobster like to me. DO NOT BUY THIS GARBAGE!

title: Absolute scam - DO NOT BUY A WINK HUB
text:
This product will NOT work with Alexa, Google Home or other controllers UNLESS YOU PAY WINK A MONTHLY FEE. 

It makes no sense if these products can connect locally to the wink hub - you are not even using wink services.  This is exactly like Philips suddenly deciding on day to charge you monthly per smart light bulb - after you had purchased them.

The worst part is that after four years of owning a wink hub, the company decided they would start charging a monthly fee for the same services I had been using for four years and for which I had bought the device. It is extortion.

I can almost understand wink charging for their cloud services, but YOU DON’T NEED CLOUD SERVICES to connect Alexa over the local network. 

I believe there is a class action lawsuit about it. Please join it.

title: Poor customer service
text: Emailed them because I could not login to their system. Despite paying for their “premium” service, I still have not heard back from them after 48 hours. Why I can’t just reset my password like I do on any other website is beyond me... but the fact that they don’t get back to you, after the whole fiasco of them bait and switching users is appaling. There are so many other hubs now, go with someone else, this company is tanking...

title: Don’t Support this company!
text: After having the wink hub for almost 2 yrs and buying it on the premise of a free service it seems wink has had a change of heart. They informed the broad base of wink platform users that they are changing to a subscription for fee service and all users have to pay up, or loose functionality. I am jumping from wink, they did enough to loose a once happy customer. Overall, wink hub to trash can and looking forward to either a smart things or hubitat replacement.

title: Server and tech problems
text: Unable to load the app’s activity log.  Unable to use the app to send a support email about the issue.  The app fails saying unable to communicate with server.   A lamp in the house keeps turning on at random times.  Seems Wink is having various technical issues.

title: Trash service
text:
This is a paid subscription hub service for smart devices with poor communication and terrible customer service. Their hub has been down I believe globally for 6 days and all we are supposed to do is check their status page for updates. This is what our annual $60 subscription equates to? Total darkness for a week? I have my business and assets protected with locks that run off this hub which has been all but useless.
No refunds were offered. Trash.

title: Only 1 star because 0 isn’t allowed
text: This company recently announced that they would be switching to a monthly subscription fee based service and that any devices on the wink hub that you already had set up would stop working if you didn’t start paying that, they gave seven days notice. The packaging on my wink hub says spicifically on it that there is not monthly fee but I’m not upset with the change I’m just upset they they gave 7 days notice and went bwack on their word.

title: Horrible app, Worse Company
text: I have a wink hub 2, and it has been spotty at best, despite my bulbs. I would have been only slightly irritated at the service, but then Wink decided to be the pioneer company to attempt to charge a monthly service fee (after not doing so for 5 years). They made the decision in the midst of a crisis, and I’m disgusted by their greed. For your own sanity, if you’re just downloading the app then you probably just bought a hub. You’re within your return period. Run to another company.

title: Once free now subscription based with a week notice
text:
I used to love my wink. One time hub purchase and free app to communicate. Now I have received an email that the free service is gone and I have a week to pay up or my wink app shuts down. 

Wow wink, not cool. So basically you’ve made your money from my purchases and you want more money for the same features. Sounds like you have a poor business model and poor financial planning. 

I’m out and not coming back. Best of dissolving your business.

title: Bugs in app
text:
The number of bugs is becoming a nuisance.
1.  I get alerts telling me my garage door mysterious opened and later closed.
2.  Robot turns on lights at night while we are home when it’s suppose to turn lights on when we come home after a specified time.
3.  Turn off a light and the icon still shows light is on.
4.  Have to attempt to add a device 2-3 times before it appears in app.

title: Lights Out, Wink
text:
In order to keep their lights on, Wink is making us customers pay to keep ours on. 

Over the course of the past 5 years, like many others, I’ve invested hundreds of dollars in Wink smart devices. Now, they’re trying to charge a monthly subscription per linked device to continue receiving service. 

This is a classic case of corporate greed and failure. I will not be investing another penny into this failing company. It’s time to say, lights out to Wink and their shady business practices.

title: Keeps getting worse
text: Have had wink for about six months. In that time I've had to have my hub replaced, my relay replaced and a door sensor replaced. It seems that every time a upgrade is available it ends up downgrading. The App will tell you lights are on when they are off and vice versa. Very undependable and unreliable. I would suggest not getting a Wink system. Every time I have talked to the support desk, they have been no help. And now their free crappy service is gonna be $4.99 a month. CROOKS!!!!

title: Love it
text: I’ve used it for a couple years to control door locks and smoke alarms at a remote location. Works great. Just upgraded to Hub2. Had some problems with the upgrade but Jared from Wink patiently helped me thru them. Looking forward to Hub2 being faster and more compatible with other pieces of equipment.

title: Disappointing Development
text:
After owning the Wink hub for two years, I’m sad to say that I’m not very impressed with product growth or development.  I was actually excited when Will I Am purchased the company thinking he would breath new life into it and bring home automation to a new level... not so much.  For starters, support for Apple Watch went a way with the empty promise of finding new ways to integrate AW(after a year... still nothing).

When this hub quits working, I will most likely move to another product for home automation.

title: Reliable, Works and Recommended
text: I’ve had the Hub (ver 1) with a Relay connected to 7 GE and 12 Hue bulbs, Liftmaster Garage opener and Schlage locks for 3 years, all operate without issue in my Airport WiFi environment.  I should add that Robots work daily as programmed and the Home Sitter function is great.  If you give it a try, you might just like it as much as I do.

title: This Company Stinks
text:
After I have invested a lot of my time and money on settling up home automation network using their products, they now switched to a subscription model trying to blackmail their loyal customers to pay a monthly subscription. I bought 6 of their proprietary Quirky Pivot Power Genius power strips. Now I can’t use them unless I pay the subscription. And they won’t work with any other automation hub. What a waste!

Stay away from this company and their products!

title: Works well...I love it!
text: I purchased my wink system a few months ago and I love it! I had a few issues setting it up but the wink team guided me through any issues (like connecting to the hub) I encountered. Great product and professional staff.

title: Needs more work and Apple Watch app
text: I came late to the game and never got the Apple Watch app which would be REALLY nice to have especially for locks. I can say that the Chamberlain MyQ Garage opener doesn’t work properly. Myq Garage won’t relay the correct information if trying to use it to open the door within Wink. It is good for automation and their customer service is good.

title: Horrible with Hue
text: Every time I need to control any Philips Hue lighting via one of 3 Wink Relays I get an account error and I need to sign back into Hue and press the button on the Hue hub. The app is the same story... it can never stay connected. What’s worse is the need to do a hard reset on the Relays... seems like monthly. This causes the lights connected to that particular switch to become non functional until the reset. I have invested too much for this lack of functionality that could likely be fixed with updates!

title: Do not purchase
text: Wink decided to suddenly go with a subscription service, but supposedly your lights can still work if you are at home and on the your network. Well that doesn’t work as I am at home and I can’t control any of my lights because I get an error message saying that payment is required. There are a lot other light services that do not require a payment service so go with one of them instead of Wink! Save yourself the headache!

title: Worthless
text: The app was a nice perk to have after buying an Aros ac unit. Especially if the temp needed adjusting after you were already in bed. They transferred over to a “subscription” system and you can do literally nothing now. Absolutely no accessibility anymore. Out of your minds if you think I’m going to PAY for simple automation over my home WiFi network. Guess I’ll be moving on to more reasonable automation companies. Will never purchase anything using Wink again.

title: Relay showing offline
text: Latest app update has killed connectivity with Relay even though Relay is fully online( has ip, polls for software updates, pulls in events from other devices on screen. Wasted an hour doing everything including reset until I realized the problem is the app. Can someone fix asap?

title: Great App
text: Wink hub 2 sets up in minutes and the app is just as easy. Within a half hour you can connect products and setup robots to control everything. You need some knowledge of how apps work but very easy to figure out just by spending a little time with it.

title: Can’t sign out to switch to my other house
text:
It’s asking are you sure ? And it’s missing button it’s a joke guys.
Later you asking people to pay lol when I paid you guys already for the devices, get lost paid like 2k for that little iPad on the wall that later wink decided to drop support and now charging monthly if I want to use your broken service, get lost wink and everyone else get Samsung hub cheaper ‘ better ‘ much bigger than this losers

title: Subscription Service is Worthless!
text: Since the implementation of their subscription service, the service has been down numerous times. It was NEVER down before. There’s no way to contact any kind of support department and the updates posted are too rare. The service has been out over a week this time with no eta on a fix.  Service was flawless prior to subscription. I’ll be looking for a new way to run my smart bulbs and cancelling wink asap.

title: So far awesome
text: I have been using wink with my Alexa, Nest and some light fixtures for a couple weeks now. Had a couple setup questions, customer service gave me the fixes. Have really enjoyed the convenience. Planning to add some more devices soon.

title: Good, then better, now broke...
text: I’ve used wink for almost 4 years now. The most recent updates have caused quite a bit of frustration with me. Most were fixed, now a new gremlin has appeared.  There is no longer the ability to add user codes to Schlage locks, specifically the BE469NX.

title: Beware!!!!
text: I have been a loyal Wink supported since I bought my new home in 2016.  Imagine my surprise after all these years when I go update the app, and now all of the features I bought the device for are locked unless I pay a subscription fee of $5 a month.  I can make any changes to any of the robots I created, or use ANY of the other services I bought it for without paying.  I will be replacing my Wink with a SmartThings hub.  You should too.

title: Do not buy, bait and switch
text: I built/automated my home using the wink hub, their hub and their other products are pricey but based on reviews at the time (2017) I decided to go with them, now they want to charge a monthly subscription fee in order to use what I already paid for. I find this quite unethical and it infuriates me to the core now I have a bunch of useless devices which I now have to buy a new hub from a different brand in order to salvage the investment made.

title: Bait and switch
text: No fees when I bought this less than 2 years ago. Honestly I think you went about this the wrong way. Mistake number 1) one week notice, really? Mistake number 2) pay or your investment is worthless? Had you announced tiered pricing maybe no fee for basic service, nominal fee for advanced features, both with at least 60 day notice might have gone over a little better with your customers. Best of luck, Wink

title: Absolutely the worst
text: Their Customer Service phone number is no longer in service, they don’t respond to emails. I bought a Wink 2 Hub new. It connects to the internet but NOT the app. Their suggested fix did not work. Every other home automation device I have bought sets up quickly, this doesn’t set up AT ALL. It appears that the majority of Wink owners have similar issues. To pay a subscription fee for hardware that doesn’t work is fraud.

title: Switching to a subscription service?!
text: This joke of a company has been unreliable these last four years, with the hub down almost once a month, lights not responsive, etc. Today, they informed me that THEY ARE SWITCHING TO A SUBSCRIPTION SERVICE next week, and that if I don’t subscribe, my devices won’t work... what?!?! I’m so fed up with them as a company. No grandfathering in of previous owners. No integrity as a company... they deserve to tank, and I would strongly advise you NOT to purchase their garbage.

title: What’s the word?
text:
I have both wink 1 and wink 2 hubs.  

Whenever I try to launch Zigbee Device Updates, the app crashes out.  

Also additional devices have been stopped being added to the provisioning section even though this last year has seen an explosion of additional devices such as the Inovelli light switches. 

I want wink to come back in full force for my own selfish reasons, but without progress, it’ll stay stagnant behind ST and Hubitat.  

Full Local control should be a thing by now with Wink.  

Give us the ability to fully local control things, offer a few cloud AI things, and expand the product line.

title: Poorly Maintained Ecosystem
text:
Wink used to be great but in the last year it has fallen to be one of the worst smart home solutions. Lack of updates, lack of support, and many accessories no longer work with Wink or will take more than 4 attempts to even connect them.
Look elsewhere and try to get apple homekit, google home, or alexa to work with your devices as they are backed by an actual company.
Sorry but I'm deleting this as there are better and faster alternatives now.

title: Excellent service
text: I’ve been with Wink almost from day one. There’s been a few hiccups but they’ve always came through, and their customer service is the best, many other companies could stand to learn from Winks customer service.

title: These people are thieves.
text: I have been using the system for years now though it was never a great system I continued to use it because I was already invested. Then out of nowhere they decided to steal from customers by forcing them to pay a monthly fee or brick the hub. I immediately unplugged the piece of junk and threw it in the trash. Avoid this company at all costs and go with Apple HomeKit. Pretty sure they won’t be in business much longer anyways.

title: Extortion
text: Have home automation using a Wink hub?  Great! Wink now has control over your home automation system and can extort monthly subscription fees that didn’t exist when you purchased their hub.  Now it’s the cost of a hub plus $60/year to turn on the lights.  No thanks Wink.  I ordered a Hubitat system so that I can have all of my automation stored locally on my hub and cannot be extorted by a poorly run business or have no automation at all when said failing business becomes insolvent.

title: Better off buying a pet rock
text:
If I could give Wink Labs Inc 1/100th of a star, I would - and even that is probably too generous. 
My best analogy for Wink would be to open your window and throw your hard earned money out of it. Only throwing $$ out the window would be more productive than any Wink products, because someone else may benefit from your loss, as opposed to friggin Wink benefiting while being a sub par company. When they started out, they were great. Now? Laughable.

title: Now Requires a Subscription
text:
Wink announced a change in their TOS on May 3rd, 2020 and switched from a “no monthly fees or subscriptions” model (the wording is copied word for word from the hub’s box) to a $5/month subscription fee.  

Stay away.  This company has been very poorly managed over the past year with multiple service outages, sometimes multiple in the same week, and now they want to charge for sometimes working.

title: Works Great
text: I have all of my Lytton Caseta switches, Leviton Z-Wave, Schlage, Nest, MyQ Garage door and ring setup on the Wink 2 hub.  Allows me to connect with the right mix of products for my home that Smarterthings could not.  People who complain I often find have no idea what they are doing in the first place.  The hub has been a rockstar for me.

title: When it works, it’s great; when it doesn’t —
text: I’m about to give up on Wink. When it works it’s great, but devices will go offline for no particular reason, now the server has been down for it looks like almost 2 days. I don’t want to mess with a hub when I come home from work; fixing computers and switches and WiFi issues, and you guessed it — HUBS!

title: Highway robbery/unethical company
text: After much research we bought a set of Lutron blinds and a Wink Hub for operation.  (There were other hub/bridges which we could’ve chosen.). Then, out of the blue, Wink informs us they are moving to a subscription model, so now we have to pay $60 a year to open and close our blinds or else go buy another hub and reset everything.  This is a dishonest bait and switch.  These people are crooks.  I will never ever purchase anything by Wink again.

title: Not for tablets
text: I have many wink enabled devices in my home, and I have begun the process of installing an iPad in wall to act as a central controller. Unfortunately the wink iPad app does not do portrait at all, so I will have to make the switch to another hub. It’s a shame that something so small would have me to switch, because generally i really like all of the functionality of the wink hub.

title: Broken app
text: The overall setup of this app is honestly pathetic. Nothing connects easily, does not work properly with out going through a million steps over and over again. You go to delete robots and it asks you if you sure but then you phone freezes and there’s nothing to hit so you have to force close the app and start all over again. If you have a lot of lights and cameras connected through this app it becomes a complete headache.

title: Wish I could create robot based on a group trigger
text: I like the app for the most part.  I just wish I could set up a robot that would turn down the thermostat when all of the lights in a desired area are off instead of having to pick a representative light to create the robot.

title: Requires a fee now
text: Don’t even bother downloading the app unless you have no problem paying a monthly fee..for those who have it already we will no longer be able to use it without a paid subscription..pretty ballsy really since the app isn’t that great..they should keep a basic service for free but charge for upgrades if you wanted..I guess it’s just easier to screw everyone instead

title: Do not buy!
text: Bought hub, setup system, worked fine for a while and then had connectivity issues with Alexa occasionally.  Now Wink e-mails saying pay us $4.99/month or we will deactivate your device, with 3 days notice.  Subscription was never part of the equation when I made the hub purchase decision.  I have switched to Hubitat Elevation which uses local control for my devices minus ecobee.  I highly recommend this instead.

title: Corporate Ransomware
text: Bought Wink hub under the pretense that there would be no monthly fee. Now Wink wants $5 per month or they disable everything. Worse yet they gave me two days notice.  Wink support is not responsive. They don’t answer the phone and it took over 24 hours to respond to my last request. This is not the kind of company I would entrust my home security and home automation to.  There are better alternatives out there.

title: Good but could be better
text: iPad support still needed. I returned Wink Relay because the buttons don’t work very well & considerable delay controlling hue lights in a room. Response time overall needs to be faster for all devices, Hue switches are almost instant compared to Wink so it’s possible... wink app should also have a faster startup

title: Unreliable
text: I’m using Wink for a Schlage door lock system on a vacation rental home. Without any kind of rhyme or reason, the Wink will go offline and the only way to get it back online is to manually unplug and replug the power cord and Ethernet cable—a little difficult when you live 1200 miles away. I thought it was a wifi issue, but even with a hardwire connection, it happens. This happens a lot, not just occasionally.

title: Need dimming percentage on icons
text: The Wink 2 hub is great it currently controls 67 devices around my house. But would be 5 stars if they would put the brightness/dimming percentage on the icons so if you have to brighten or dim a light then you want to put back to where it was originally was set would be great. Maybe on an upcoming update??

title: Wink works...sometimes.
text: I use Wink to link Alexa with an iHome smart plug. That’s it. Not complicated. But it only works sometimes, and I spend way too much time troubleshooting to get it to work again. Turn plug off and on, delete and reinstall Wink app, remove plug from app and rediscover, etc. Customer service has been terrific when I’ve called, but Wink is just not worth the effort. BTW, plug works with Siri 100% of the time.

title: Inaccessible often
text: I have been contemplating dumping wink for a few months because their “service” was down.  The 1st gen hub I used lasted a long time, but it wasn’t that fast when it worked.  I switched most things over to C by GE, which is pretty good.  I wish Wink didn’t hose us with such short notice and zero access to basic features.  I bet they will be gone this year.  I recommend you stay away.

title: Wink is a scam to get your money
text:

title: Works flawlessly for me
text: The Wink Hub 2 is a strong, steady device and the app functions with it perfectly for me, and I have some pretty darned complicated scenarios that I run with it daily. I have supported devices and unsupported devices connected to the hub and the app controls them accordingly. I have a Maker account and write my own recipes for certain actions in IFTTT and have no problems with them running or communicating between the hub, app, or any of the devices I have attached. Rough estimate of devices I currently have installed is ~50; consisting of in-wall light, dimmer, and ceiling fan switches, On/Off and dimming AC outlet switches, in-wall micro switches, thermostat, window/door sensors, motion sensors, sirens, connected bulbs, you get the picture. They are all automated and have a job to do, and I can do the vast majority of what I want from within the app. The punchline is that it just works and I never have to touch it. I do, but that’s because I can’t help myself...it’s just my nature, but if I leave it alone the robots and shortcuts that I have set up run just fine. Everything plays well with Alexa, IFTTT, whatever. I can’t explain the app, hub, the entire Wink ecosystem working so well with for me and being a complete nightmare for others, but I guess it is what it is. I read one fairly negative comment that stated the app/device was only as good as its firmware, and I absolutely agree with that. I also believe that it can be limited by its owner. So, if having trouble, I’d start looking at device compatibility/support, make sure your network connection is stable, make sure the hub firmware is updated, make sure you have the latest update for the app, make sure your phone”s firmware is updated and supported by the app, check device batteries, and on and on and on. If that doesn’t sound like fun maybe the whole home automation thing really isn’t your bag because the app works fine ;)
